attributes.comment:
I'd like to comment on the proposal to increase fees for U.S. Citizenship and
Immigration Services; docket number (USCIS-2006-0044). As someone attempting to
adopt a child (an orphan) from China, we are already paying an outrageous amount
of money to do this. furthermore, as fingerprints are only "good" for 18 months,
and wait times are extending beyond 20 months (or more), we'll have to pay these
fees twice, sometimes tree times!! We can not afford it.We are trying to grow
our family in the only way we can, and we are not made of money. To increase
these fees may mean we are unable to continue with our dreams. At the VERY
LEAST, our I-171H should be extended and we should be "grandfathered in": so
those of us who have already paid these fees once won't have to pay again. Let
people who are applying now (for the first time) pay more, but don't make those
of us who have already PAID have to pay more than TWICE what we paid!! What a
terrible hardship this is for families.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Danesha Carley
